file_content.text: Shroud war journal, entry 5963. Investigation of the attacks on Republic and Imperial settlements has led to Wild Space.
New players have entered the game. That won't do. I will find these interlopers and sweep them from my board.
Shroud war journal, entry 6812. Manipulating Darth Marr and my old enemy to find Zakuul succeeded beyond all calculations.
They and that so-called "Eternal Emperor" are dead. But removing the son and daughter may be more challenging.
Shroud war journal, entry 7944. Acina declared herself Empress of the Sith.
Hardly surprising given the power vacuum, but I'm shocked by the sheer volume of popular support for that oily dianoga.
People seem to genuinely like her. What's this galaxy coming to?
Shroud war journal, entry 9233. Days like this remind me why I enjoy the great game.
My extortion campaign against Republic senators blocked Chancellor Saresh's effort to extend her term indefinitely. Once again, democracy prevails.
Shroud war journal, entry 9889. After five years of meticulous planning, "Operation Stranglehold" can finally begin.
At last, the galaxy will be under my total control. Listen to me--I'm positively giddy.
Shroud personal log, entry 80764. Five years, for nothing! How could that menace come back from the dead at the precise moment it would ruin my plans?
I hate, hate, hate that "Outlander"! Going to bed early.
Shroud war journal, entry 0001A. Starting a new diary and a clean slate for "Operation Kill the Outlander."
Enemy intel is scarce for now, but I'll soon fix that. There are plenty of Alliance droids wandering about, after all.
Shroud war journal, entry 4281. I captured an SIS agent on Coruscant. A friend of Theron Shan and a minion of Saresh.
He revealed so much valuable information, but I'll never get his smell out of the interrogation room. I'll build a new one.
Shroud personal log, entry 54171. I caught the cleaner staring at my terminal for more than three seconds. He claimed it was an accident.
I removed his eyes, tongue, and fingers to safeguard my secrets. He reacted... poorly. I'll have to replace him--and revise my employment contract.
